In the story of the stilling of the storm, Jesus rebuked
explanation:
In the story of the stilling of the storm (found inMark 4:35–41,Matthew 8:23–27, andLuke 8:22–25), Jesus was in a boat with His disciples when a violent storm arose. The disciples, afraid of drowning, woke Him. Jesus thenrebuked the wind and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!”(Mark 4:39, RSV). The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
This action showsJesus’ authority over nature. After calming the storm,He questioned His disciples' faith, butHe directly rebuked the sea and the wind, not the disciples themselves.
